alert.note: Alert for Western El Paso County (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 11 at 11:10AM CST until January 12 at 1:00AM CST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... * WHAT...For the Blowing Dust Advisory, visibility between one quarter mile and one mile in blowing dust. For the Wind Advisory, west winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * WHERE...In New Mexico, Lowlands of the Bootheel, East Central Tularosa Basin/Alamogordo and Southeast Tularosa Basin. In Texas, Western El Paso County. * WHEN...For the Blowing Dust Advisory, until 9 PM MST this evening. For the Wind Advisory, until midnight MST tonight. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to reduced visibility. Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Local areas may temporarily see visibilities reduced below one quarter mile between 1 pm and 6 pm. .
info.instruction: Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. Remember, Pull Aside, Stay Alive. Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
